TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner

Docs.summary: Extends design-time behavior for the Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> class. The code overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to customize the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.CellPadding%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderColor%2A> properties when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is rendered on a design surface.
[!code-vb[DataListDesigner_Sample2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataListDesigner_Sample2/VB/simpledatalistdesigner.vb#1)]
The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute to associate the designer with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
[!code-vb[DataListDesigner_Sample2#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataListDesigner_Sample2/VB/simpledatalistdesigner.vb#5)]

Docs.related: How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

To support template editing expose template data in the TemplateGroups property and call SetViewFlags(ViewFlags.TemplateEditing, true). http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Creates a template editing frame using the specified verb.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub Dispose (disposing As Boolean)

Docs.param: to release both the managed and unmanaged resources; to release only the unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.Dispose%2A> method releases all the resources held by the managed objects that this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> object references.

block.para:
The method can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding it, be sure that you do not reference objects that have been disposed in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement this method, see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
For more information about the and methods, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/ddae83kx(v=vs.100)).

Docs.related: How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDesignTimeHtml () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML markup used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: The HTML markup that is used to represent the control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to alter the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control on the design surface.
The code uses `Try...Catch...Finally` syntax to do the following:
- The `Try` section changes the values of the properties of the data grid control.
- The `Catch` section catches any exceptions and sends them to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
- The `Finally` section sets the properties to their original values.
This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> class.
[!code-vb[DataListDesigner_Sample2#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataListDesigner_Sample2/VB/simpledatalistdesigner.vb#2)]

Docs.related: How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

Docs.returns: The HTML markup used to represent an empty template-based control at design time.
Docs.related: How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetErrorDesignTimeHtml (e As Exception) As String

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML markup displayed at design time for the specified exception when an error has been encountered while rendering the control.
Docs.returns: The HTML markup displayed at design time for the specified exception.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to modify the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control on the design surface when an exception occurs.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> class.
[!code-vb[DataListDesigner_Sample2#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataListDesigner_Sample2/VB/simpledatalistdesigner.vb#3)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.Initialize%2A> method to ensure that the designer is only initialized with instances of the `SimpleDataGrid` class.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> class.
